result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayshawn D Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rayshawn D Harris in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Rayshawn D Harris.  Assistant District Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds the state has complied with victim notification.   
Amended Information received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading, and plead not guilty on behalf of defendant.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Discussion regarding whether the defendant should be remanded was discussed.  The Court ordered defendant to immediately go to justice point for a drug test.  Jake from Justice Point phoned to advise the court the defendant's test was negative.  Defendant was not remanded.  Case remains calendared in Br 45 for sentencing on November 21,2022 at 1:30pm  mn

Defendant Rayshawn D Harris in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Case is adjourned for Arraignment to Br. 34.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/18/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Rayshawn D Harris in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
